title: philipma1957
author: philipma1957
content: My nicehash kawpow seem to be more than double when did this start back up?

comments.author: Metroid
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 26, 2023, 09:53:37 PMMy nicehash kawpow seem to be more than double when did this start back up?10 times from bottom to be exactly, look for xna, it seems the AI hype is paying off to whoever started it and by the way ETH and pos coins are all dead because they are all centralized.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 26, 2023, 09:53:37 PMMy nicehash kawpow seem to be more than double when did this start back up?CloreAI pleased with its good profit growth. The project is going to update the panel for renting capacity and expand the interface.But the kawpow algorithm consumes more power.Check this out. If you mine on the CloreAI platform, the profit is much higherhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F9bNaAL4hjY&If you have a lot of powerful Nvidia video cards, then you might be interested in this.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: It is pretty crazy. The price doesn’t seem to be that high so maybe some miners came off the network or something? I haven’t explored it much. I am surprised to see that even my old 1080ti rigs are once again profitable as a result. Those babies just keep on bringing profits year after year. Amazing really.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on December 02, 2023, 01:38:29 AMIt is pretty crazy. The price doesn’t seem to be that high so maybe some miners came off the network or something? I haven’t explored it much. I am surprised to see that even my old 1080ti rigs are once again profitable as a result. Those babies just keep on bringing profits year after year. Amazing really. I can run a profit in my house at 14 cent power which is pretty good thing.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on December 02, 2023, 01:38:29 AMIt is pretty crazy. The price doesn’t seem to be that high so maybe some miners came off the network or something? I haven’t explored it much. I am surprised to see that even my old 1080ti rigs are once again profitable as a result. Those babies just keep on bringing profits year after year. Amazing really. The price of the slore coin has increased.I tried the service https://clore.ai/ and there are some points that I don’t like. On this service you must use standard settings for mining and for renting, otherwise you will receive negative reviews and the administration will not give you the MFP.At standard settings, my video cards consume more power and get hot. Lelom, this mode will be bad for video cards without ventilation, so I decided to stay in dual mining clore+zill.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on December 02, 2023, 02:42:14 PMQuote from: OgNasty on December 02, 2023, 01:38:29 AMIt is pretty crazy. The price doesn’t seem to be that high so maybe some miners came off the network or something? I haven’t explored it much. I am surprised to see that even my old 1080ti rigs are once again profitable as a result. Those babies just keep on bringing profits year after year. Amazing really. I can run a profit in my house at 14 cent power which is pretty good thing.This time of year I pay weird usage fees on my grandfathered electricity plan that inflate my bill (I could save money monthly if I moved to a different plan), but I also get a $0.03/kWh rate which makes mining pretty profitable. If only it was winter year round… Once I get a Tesla I think that grandfathered plan will really start paying dividends. Now it’s really only useful in the winter when I need miner heat.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on December 05, 2023, 08:53:22 PMQuote from: philipma1957 on December 02, 2023, 02:42:14 PMQuote from: OgNasty on December 02, 2023, 01:38:29 AMIt is pretty crazy. The price doesn’t seem to be that high so maybe some miners came off the network or something? I haven’t explored it much. I am surprised to see that even my old 1080ti rigs are once again profitable as a result. Those babies just keep on bringing profits year after year. Amazing really. I can run a profit in my house at 14 cent power which is pretty good thing.This time of year I pay weird usage fees on my grandfathered electricity plan that inflate my bill (I could save money monthly if I moved to a different plan), but I also get a $0.03/kWh rate which makes mining pretty profitable. If only it was winter year round… Once I get a Tesla I think that grandfathered plan will really start paying dividends. Now it’s really only useful in the winter when I need miner heat. A very good tariff, but does it allow mining or do you have to steal mining from controllers, as miners do in Russia?If there are no problems with the controllers, then I would use all the maximum power for mining while the videocaps are cheap.
